overview: Develop a highly compliant, technically robust proposal for Phase 1 SSES services in the LaSalle area that clearly demonstrates understanding of NYSDEC/NYS EFC requirements, the Order on Consent, and NFWB’s SSO abatement objectives, while differentiating Aurelia Digital Systems through strong data, analytics, governance, and documentation capabilities. The plan also positions the team for Phases 2 and 3 with clear optional pricing and schedules.

sections.title: 1. Cover Letter and Executive Summary
sections.summary: Concise introduction to Aurelia Digital Systems, confirmation of commitment to perform Phase 1 SSES and optional Phases 2 and 3, acknowledgment of key constraints (Order on Consent, NYSDEC/NYS EFC, schedule), and high-level value proposition.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid flowchart showing linkage from Phase 1 SSES to corrective actions to post-construction monitoring and compliance with Order on Consent
suggested_tables: Table summarizing Phase 1, Phase 2 (Option 1), and Phase 3 (Option 2) scope at a glance

sections.title: 2. Administrative Compliance and Proposal Submission Plan
sections.summary: Demonstrate understanding and compliance with all administrative, submission, and communication requirements including mandatory pre-proposal meeting, sealed submission, deadlines, addenda, and restricted communications.
rfp_pages: Appendix instructions for copies and electronic submission
suggested_diagrams: mermaid timeline diagram showing key pre-award milestones: pre-proposal meeting, questions deadline, addenda, proposal due date, 90-day hold period
suggested_tables: Checklist table of all administrative requirements (forms, copies, envelopes, deadlines) with responsible party and status column

sections.title: 3. Understanding of NFWB Objectives, System, and Regulatory Context
sections.summary: Demonstrate situational understanding of LaSalle sewersheds, I&I and SSO issues, Order on Consent, NYSDEC expectations, NYS EFC Engineering Planning Grant requirements, and how Phase 1 SSES fits into broader SSO abatement strategy.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid system context diagram showing LaSalle sewersheds, outfalls/SSOs, monitoring points, and data/reporting flows to NFWB and NYSDEC
suggested_charts: Seaborn bar chart illustrating hypothetical or historical SSO/I&I drivers by category (smoke test defects, inflow sources, structural defects) to show understanding of problem composition
suggested_tables: Table mapping regulatory/Order on Consent requirements to planned deliverables and checkpoints

sections.title: 4. Detailed Technical Approach – Phase 1 SSES Tasks 1–8
sections.summary: Provide a task-by-task methodology for executing all required Phase 1 SSES tasks (1–8) in the specified LaSalle sewersheds, explicitly showing how the approach meets or exceeds the RFP’s minimum scope, including sequencing and integration across tasks.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid flowchart depicting end-to-end SSES workflow from data review (Task 1) through field investigations (Tasks 2–6), reporting (Task 7), and post-construction monitoring (Task 8)
mermaid sequence diagram showing interactions between Aurelia team, NFWB staff, NYSDEC, and residents during key field activities (smoke testing, flow isolation, outfall assessment)
suggested_charts: Seaborn Gantt-style bar chart showing duration and overlaps of Tasks 1–8 within the required timeline to enable 2023 construction and 2024 monitoring
suggested_tables: Task-by-task methodology table summarizing objectives, inputs, methods, outputs, and success criteria for Tasks 1–8
Risk and mitigation table for each major task (e.g., weather for smoke testing, access constraints)

sections.title: 4.1 Task 1 – Project Management, Data Review, and Coordination
sections.summary: Describe identification of a single Project Manager, data review process, understanding of system history and Order on Consent, and ongoing consultation/meetings with NFWB and NYSDEC.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid RACI-style diagram (using graph notation) showing roles and responsibilities for project management, coordination, and decision-making
suggested_tables: Table listing key coordination meetings (kickoff, data review, interim findings, draft report review, NYSDEC coordination) with objectives and participants

sections.title: 4.2 Task 2 – Smoke Testing Plan and Execution
sections.summary: Explain detailed plan for planning and executing smoke testing, including staffing, equipment, resident notifications, public safety coordination, weather considerations, and documentation of defects.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid flowchart of smoke testing workflow from planning and notifications through field execution, documentation, and data entry into GIS/database
suggested_tables: Table of notification and coordination steps (door hangers, press releases, police/fire notices) with lead times and responsible parties

sections.title: 4.3 Task 3 – Flow Isolation and Measurement
sections.summary: Detail methodology for reviewing existing flow data, selecting weir locations, providing equipment and traffic control, ensuring confined space safety, coordinating with NFWB for cleaning, notifying residents, and analyzing data to compute infiltration rates.
rfp_pages: Task 3 Description – Flow Isolation and Measurement
Safety and Confined Space Requirements Section
suggested_diagrams: mermaid diagram of flow isolation process including site selection, setup, measurement, QA/QC, and data analysis
suggested_charts: Seaborn line chart example showing diurnal flow patterns and rainfall overlay to illustrate planned analysis approach
Seaborn bar chart template for infiltration rates (gpd/lf) by weiring section
suggested_tables: Table summarizing proposed measurement locations, rationale, and anticipated monitoring durations

sections.title: 4.4 Task 4 – CCTV and Manhole Data Analysis
sections.summary: Describe process to analyze NFWB-provided CCTV and manhole inspection reports, identify needs for additional data, coordinate NFWB CCTV crews, and integrate findings into I&I source identification.
rfp_pages: Task 4 Description – CCTV and Manhole Inspection Analysis
suggested_diagrams: mermaid data-flow diagram showing how CCTV/manhole data moves from NFWB systems into Aurelia’s analysis environment and into the SSES report
suggested_tables: Defect classification table showing how CCTV findings will be categorized (e.g., structural, O&M, I&I-related) and mapped to recommended actions

sections.title: 4.5 Task 5 – Outfall/SSO Condition Assessment
sections.summary: Present approach to assessing two Phase 1 outfalls/SSOs, including work plan development (potential meters, rain gauges, dye testing, confined space entry, CCTV coordination), execution upon authorization, GIS-compatible documentation, and recommendations to reduce extraneous flows.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid diagram of outfall assessment workflow from desktop review to field investigations to GIS documentation and recommendations
suggested_charts: Seaborn before/after bar chart template for outfall flow conditions (to be used in post-construction reporting)
suggested_tables: Table listing each outfall, planned assessment methods, instrumentation, and expected data outputs

sections.title: 4.6 Task 6 – Focused SSES and Contingency Use
sections.summary: Explain strategy for targeted investigations (dye testing, house inspections, additional CCTV) to confirm I&I sources, management of the $10,000 contingency budget, and approval process with NFWB.
rfp_pages: Task 6 Description – Focused SSES and Contingency
suggested_diagrams: mermaid decision-tree diagram showing when and how focused investigations are triggered based on findings from Tasks 2–5
suggested_tables: Contingency management table describing potential uses of Task 6 contingency, approval workflow, and tracking columns

sections.title: 4.7 Task 7 – SSES Engineering Report and Corrective Action Plan
sections.summary: Detail the plan to prepare the SSES report for NYSDEC that identifies I&I sources, prioritizes cost-effective flow reduction measures, includes budgetary costs and implementation timelines, adheres to the NYSDEC Engineering Report Outline, and is stamped by a NY-licensed PE in time for 2023 construction.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid diagram mapping report sections to NYSDEC Engineering Report Outline elements and Order on Consent requirements
suggested_charts: Seaborn bar chart of recommended corrective actions by category and estimated I&I reduction impact
Seaborn stacked bar chart of implementation timeline (short-, medium-, long-term measures)
suggested_tables: Corrective action matrix table listing I&I source, recommended action, estimated cost, estimated I&I reduction, priority, and implementation window

sections.title: 4.8 Task 8 – Post-Construction Monitoring and I&I Assessment
sections.summary: Describe methodology for post-construction monitoring of Phase 1 improvements in 2024, including flow and rainfall data collection, comparison with pre-construction conditions, and preparation of Post-Construction I&I Assessment and Cost Analysis Report for NYSDEC.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid timeline diagram for pre- vs. post-construction monitoring windows and reporting milestones
suggested_charts: Seaborn line charts comparing pre- and post-construction flow vs. rainfall
Seaborn cost-effectiveness scatter plot template (cost vs. I&I reduction for each implemented measure)
suggested_tables: Table summarizing monitoring locations, parameters, and statistical comparison methods for pre/post analysis

sections.title: 5. Optional Services Approach – Phase 2 and Phase 3 SSES
sections.summary: Present approach, schedule, and fees for Option 1 (Phase 2 SSES in 81st & Frontier 2 and 80th & Lindbergh, omitting Task 5) and Option 2 (Phase 3 SSES in Mang & 88th including one outfall assessment), demonstrating scalability and continuity from Phase 1.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid multi-phase roadmap showing Phase 1, Phase 2, and Phase 3 sequencing and dependencies
suggested_charts: Seaborn bar chart comparing level of effort (hours) by task between Phases 1, 2, and 3
suggested_tables: Option comparison table summarizing scope, schedule, and not-to-exceed fees for Phase 2 and Phase 3

sections.title: 6. Project Organization, Key Personnel, and Subconsultants
sections.summary: Describe project organization, roles and responsibilities, key personnel qualifications and licensing, subconsultants and their roles, and how the team structure supports safe, compliant execution of SSES tasks including confined space work.
rfp_pages: Proposal Content Requirements – Team and Qualifications Section
suggested_diagrams: mermaid org chart diagram showing reporting relationships among NFWB, Aurelia PM, technical leads, field crews, and subconsultants
suggested_tables: Key personnel table listing names, roles, licenses, years of experience, and relevant SSES/utility project experience
Subconsultant table summarizing firms performing >10% of work, scope, and certifications

sections.title: 7. Relevant Experience and Past Performance
sections.summary: Provide statement of qualifications, including business structure, years in business, similar project experience (especially for utilities and public sector), references, and disclosure of any debarments, defaults, legal actions, or conflicts, tying back to the RFP’s responsibility criteria.
suggested_charts: Seaborn bar chart summarizing key past projects by size (contract value) and duration to show scale-handling capability
suggested_tables: Project experience matrix mapping similar projects to scope elements (I&I analysis, regulatory reporting, complex data analysis) and client references
Disclosure table addressing required responsibility items (debarment, defaults, litigation, etc.)

sections.title: 8. Project Schedule and Work Plan
sections.summary: Provide detailed schedule showing sequencing and durations of all Phase 1 tasks, critical milestones to meet NYSDEC review timeline and construction window, and integrated work plan aligning with NFWB’s operational constraints.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid Gantt chart-style diagram for Phase 1 tasks, key milestones (kickoff, fieldwork windows, draft/final reports, NYSDEC submittals), and dependencies
suggested_charts: Seaborn bar chart (as required) depicting schedule by task and month
suggested_tables: Milestone table listing key dates, deliverables, and responsible roles
Work window table for field activities (smoke testing, flow isolation, outfall assessments) with seasonal/weather constraints

sections.title: 9. Management Approach, Governance, and Communication
sections.summary: Explain overall management and governance model, including decision-making, issue/risk management, quality assurance, coordination with NFWB and other contractors, public communications, and readiness for interviews/presentations.
suggested_diagrams: mermaid governance diagram showing steering, working, and field coordination forums and escalation paths
suggested_tables: Communication plan table detailing audiences (NFWB, NYSDEC, residents, emergency services), communication types, frequency, and channels
Risk register table with likelihood/impact and mitigation/contingency actions

sections.title: 10. Cost Proposal, Level of Effort, and Invoicing
sections.summary: Provide detailed cost proposal including not-to-exceed fee, task/hour estimate matrix, contingency for Task 6, breakdown by labor category and task, and explanation of monthly invoicing, documentation, and acceptance of 60-day terms and tax exemption.
suggested_charts: Seaborn pie chart showing cost distribution by major task group (field investigations, analysis, reporting, management)
suggested_tables: Spreadsheet-style task/hour estimate matrix by role and task (as required)
Not-to-exceed fee summary table including base services, Task 6 contingency, and optional Phases 2 and 3
Billing and invoicing terms acknowledgment table summarizing compliance with monthly invoicing, documentation, and payment terms

sections.title: 11. MWBE and SDVOB Participation Strategy
sections.summary: Describe approach to meeting or exceeding MWBE and SDVOB participation goals, including identification of potential MWBE/SDVOB subconsultants, utilization plans or waiver requests, good-faith effort documentation, and ongoing reporting processes.
rfp_pages: Appendix F – Mandatory State Financial Assistance Terms and Conditions
suggested_diagrams: mermaid process diagram for MWBE/SDVOB engagement from sourcing and onboarding through utilization tracking and reporting
suggested_charts: Seaborn stacked bar chart showing planned percentage of contract value by vendor type (prime, MWBE, SDVOB, other) against targets
suggested_tables: MWBE/SDVOB utilization plan table listing each firm, certification type, scope, and estimated dollar/percentage participation
Reporting calendar table for MWBE-SDVOB and workforce reporting

sections.title: 12. Regulatory, Legal, and Contractual Compliance
sections.summary: Explicitly acknowledge and describe compliance with NYSDEC and NYS EFC requirements, Order on Consent, Appendix E and F terms (including indemnification, insurance, FOIL, data security, prevailing wage, non-discrimination, Iran Divestment Act, boycott, MacBride, tropical hardwood, conflicts of interest), and identify any exceptions on a separate attachment.
rfp_pages: Appendix E – Standard Terms and Conditions
Appendix F – Mandatory State Financial Assistance Terms and Conditions
suggested_tables: Compliance matrix table mapping each key contractual/regulatory requirement to specific proposal sections, responsible roles, and acceptance/exception status
Insurance coverage table summarizing required coverages, limits, carriers, and ability to name additional insureds

sections.title: 13. Forms, Certifications, and Exceptions Attachment
sections.summary: List and confirm inclusion of all required Appendix E forms (1–6), MWBE/SDVOB utilization plans or waivers, EEO Staffing Plan, and any exceptions in a clearly labeled attachment.
suggested_tables: Checklist table of all completed forms and attachments with signature status and location in proposal

sections.title: 14. Alignment with Aurelia Delivery Model and Quality Assurance
sections.summary: Connect Aurelia’s standard delivery phases (Initiate, Discover, Design, Build, Deploy, Operate & Improve) and security/governance practices to the SSES project, emphasizing disciplined execution, documentation, and audit-ready evidence for regulators.
rfp_pages: Evaluation Criteria – Project Approach and Understanding Section
suggested_diagrams: mermaid mapping of Aurelia delivery phases to SSES tasks and deliverables
suggested_tables: Table aligning Aurelia’s quality and governance practices (stage gates, design reviews, security checkpoints) with SSES project milestones and deliverables

sections.title: 15. Interview and Presentation Readiness (If Requested)
sections.summary: Outline approach for informal interviews and potential presentations with NFWB staff and Water Board, including how alternative methods and innovations will be communicated and how key staff will participate.
rfp_pages: Evaluation and Selection Process Section – Interviews/Presentations
suggested_tables: Table of proposed interview/presentation team members, roles, and topics they will cover

key_themes: Regulatory alignment and Order on Consent compliance as a central organizing principle for the technical approach and schedule
Data-driven I&I analysis and clear traceability from field observations to corrective actions and measured post-construction benefits
Strong project governance, communication, and documentation tailored to public-sector and utility environments
Proactive risk management for schedule-critical activities (smoke testing, flow isolation, report delivery) to enable 2023 construction and 2024 monitoring
Meaningful MWBE and SDVOB participation with transparent planning and reporting
Safety-first execution including confined space entry, coordination with other contractors, and robust health and safety planning
Scalable, multi-phase roadmap that positions Aurelia as a long-term partner across Phases 1–3
win_strategy: Differentiate by combining strict compliance with NYSDEC/NYS EFC and Order on Consent requirements with Aurelia’s strengths in data, analytics, and governance. Emphasize a highly structured, auditable approach to SSES: rigorous data integration from smoke testing, flow isolation, CCTV, and focused investigations; transparent prioritization of corrective actions based on cost-effectiveness; and robust pre- and post-construction monitoring and reporting tailored to NYSDEC expectations. Underscore Aurelia’s public-sector and utilities experience, formal delivery phases, and security/compliance engineering to reassure NFWB that all regulatory, contractual, and reporting obligations will be met without surprises. Demonstrate strong MWBE/SDVOB engagement and safety culture, and present a clear, realistic schedule that de-risks the critical path to 2023 construction and 2024 monitoring. Finally, show that Aurelia’s documentation and visualization practices (including GIS-compatible outputs and clear diagrams) will make complex findings understandable for NFWB, NYSDEC, and the Water Board, supporting approvals and funding decisions.
